Hi I'm Jeff

I work on figuring out how to go from raw data from next generation sequencing machines to results, turning public genomic data into clinically useful tools, and understanding how people use data analysis in real life.

I do statistical research, write data analysis software, write a blog about statistics, teach a few people here at Hopkins, teach a lot of people online, and work with amazing students who go do awesome things.

If you want to keep up with everything we are working on, follow me on Twitter @jtleek.
